channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: As Trump dismantles the existing world order, his version is still taking shape
item.description: In his second term, the president is embracing a foreign policy that breaks sharply from U.S. tradition. Both supporters and critics say he's upending...

item.title: Trump's Board of Peace has several invited leaders trying to figure out how it'll work
item.description: It's unclear how many leaders have been asked to join the board, and the large number of invitations being sent out, including to countries that don't...

item.title: Trump promised to cut energy bills in half. One year later, has he delivered?
item.description: Cheap gasoline, yes. Drill, baby, drill? Not so much. And electricity bills are going up, not down.

item.title: Polyester clothing has been causing a stir online. But how valid are the concerns?
item.description: There has been a lot of conversation on social media about the downsides of polyester. But are those downsides as bad as they're believed to be? Are t...

item.title: Researchers find Antarctic penguin breeding is heating up sooner
item.description: Warming temperatures are forcing Antarctic penguins to breed earlier and that's a big problem for two of the cute tuxedoed species that face extinctio...

item.title: Trump U-turns on U.K.-Chagos Islands deal, links it to bid for Greenland
item.description: Trump says the U.K. decision to hand a strategic island to Mauritius, which he previously supported, was stupid, and justification for his attempt to ...

item.title: Surrounded by billionaires in Davos, Trump plans to lay out how he’ll make housing more affordable
Greenland 'will stay Greenland', former Trump adviser declares
item.description: Donald Trump's former chief economic adviser said the US president's actions are a negotiating tactic.

item.title: Anthony Joshua's driver appears in court after crash that killed two
item.description: The former heavyweight champion was a passenger in the crash, which killed two of his team members.

item.title: China demands Taliban protect its citizens after deadly Kabul blast
item.description: The Islamic State group says they were behind the blast in Kabul, but police say they are still investigating the cause.

item.title: US citizen says ICE removed him from his Minnesota home in his underwear after warrantless search
Spain begins national mourning for train crash victims as death toll rises
item.description: The death toll from the train crash in southern Spain rose to 41 after the body of another passenger was recovered from one of the carriages.

item.title: Twelve schoolchildren killed after bus collides with lorry in South Africa
item.description: The fatal collision is just the latest in South Africa, where the road safety record is poor.

item.title: 1/19: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Minneapolis ICE protests continue in face of Trump's Insurrection Act threat; Indiana and Miami students reflect on lead-up to football championship.

item.title: Spain train crash recovery continues as investigators probe 'gap' in rail
item.description: Authorities say the twisted train wreckage makes it difficult to recover people trapped inside.

item.title: After 4 shark attacks, beachgoers urged to "just go to a local pool"
item.description: Authorities warned that recent rainfall has left the water off area beaches murky, which increased the risk of bull shark attacks.

item.title: Pardoned Jan. 6 rioter to face criminal trial for child molestation
item.description: Andrew Johnson is the latest in a series of pardoned Jan. 6 riot defendants to face new criminal charges.

item.title: Christian leaders urge protecting worshippers’ rights after protesters interrupt service
item.description: Several faith leaders are urgently calling for protecting the rights of worshippers while also expressing compassion for migrants.
